New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 50th ODI century, breaking the record previously held by Sachin Tendulkar
Mohammed Shami finished with 7 wickets for 57 runs, setting a new record for the quickest 50 wickets in World Cup cricket
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 83 off 56 balls, setting a blistering start for India
Tim Southee took the wicket of Rohit Sharma, ending his innings
Shubman Gill retired hurt after scoring 79 off 65 balls
Virat Kohli reached his century, breaking the record for the most runs in a single edition of the World Cup
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and elected to bat
Rohit Sharma expressed confidence in the team's ability to handle the pressure of a knockout game
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's performance and the record-breaking innings
Kane Williamson acknowledged New Zealand's defeat and praised India's batting performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: David Beckham was present at the match
The pitch was changed at the last minute to a used one, potentially favoring the team batting second
Others: The match was played under lights, with the Wankhede stadium providing a festive atmosphere
